H0.text: Located in a country of the same name which is African's second highest mountain. Kilimanjaro

H1.text: Located in a country of the same name which is African's second highest mountain. Mount Stanley

H2.text: Located in a country of the same name which is African's second highest mountain. Mount Speke

H3.text: Located in a country of the same name which is African's second highest mountain. Lenana

A4.text: Mount Kilimanjaro can be seen from Kenya to the south of the Tanzanian border.

A5.text: Point Lenana is a peak on Mount Kenya.

A6.text: Mount Kilimanjaro is a large dormant volcano in Tanzania.

A7.text: Mount Kilimanjaro is the highest mountain in Africa and the highest free-standing mountain above sea level in the world, at 5,895 m (19,341 ft) above sea level.

A8.text: Glacial Recession on Kilimanjaro (pictures of southern icefields)

A10.text: With an elevation of 5,109 m (16,763 ft), it is the highest mountain of both the Democratic Republic of the Congo and Uganda, and the fourth-highest in Africa.

A11.text: Mount Speke lies in the Ruwenzori Mountains National Park in Uganda.

A12.text: Mount Speke is the second highest mountain in this range.

A13.text: Mount Speke was named after John Speke.

A14.text: Mount Kenya is the second-highest peak in Africa, after Kilimanjaro.
